settings.title: Flip Card
settings.directionsTextVer: Answer the following questions. Select each flip card to review the answer.

cardfront.text: What are the Chinese New Year traditions in Karen’s family that are similar to Kailan’s?

cardback.text: Both families have the New Year’s Eve family dinner and put up couplets and lanterns, and children receive red packets from adults in the family.

cardfront.text: What are some Chinese traditions that Karen’s family observe during Christmas or any other Western holidays?

cardback.text: They observe the Chinese traditions, such as adults giving red packets or presents to children, having family dinners, and visiting relatives.

cardfront.text: Who takes care of Karen’s maternal grandparents?

cardback.text: Her maternal grandparents live in a senior home with a pension. Her mom and her siblings take turns visiting them and taking care of financial matters when needed.

cardfront.text: Did Karen’s great-grandparents date before they got married, and how is it different from Kailan’s great-grandparents?

cardback.text: Karen’s great-grandparents dated and wrote love letters to each other before they got married. Kailan’s great-grandparents didn’t date or even touch each other’s hands before they got married.
